awards.summary: A five-year fellowship awarded for establishing my inaugural laboratory at University College London, which was instrumental in the development of Tocky.

certificates.issuer: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare, Japan

publications.name: A timer for analyzing temporally dynamic changes in transcription during differentiation in vivo
publications.summary: The first report of the Tocky technology, establishing the transgenic lines Nr4a3-Tocky and Foxp3-Tocky and data analytic methods to analyse Timer fluorescence data.

publications.name: A temporally dynamic Foxp3 autoregulatory transcriptional circuit controls the effector Treg programme
publications.summary: The second Tocky paper, establishing Foxp3 Tocky as a method to analyse temporal changes of regulatory T cell function, identifying the autoregulatory loop of the Foxp3 gene.

publications.name: Visualising the cross-level relationships between pathological and physiological processes and gene expression: analyses of haematological diseases
publications.summary: The development of Canonical Correspondence Analysis as a genomic method to analyse transcriptome data in biomedical contexts, establishing quantitative measures for the degree of cellular differentiation using haematological disease datasets.

innovations.name: Tocky
keywords: Data Analysis: Linear Algebra and Multidimensional Analysis

innovations.name: Application of Canonical Correspondence Analysis (CCA) for Genomic Studies

projects.name: Human Frontier Science Progam Long-Term Fellowship:
projects.summary: The project enabled development of skills in mathematical and computational immunology, leading to pioneering Canonical Correspondence Analysis in genomic analysis.

projects.name: BBSRC Fellowship: Elucidation of the transcriptional programme of memory T cells by a systems approach
projects.summary: The project investigated mechanisms underlying T cell memory and regulation, innovating the Tocky technology and utilising it to discover novel molecular mechanisms in T-cells.

projects.name: MRC Project Grant: Investigation of the generation and functional maturation of regulatory T cells in vivo
projects.summary: The project investigated mechanisms underlying regulatory T cell differentiation and function using Tocky and various molecular immunology approaches.

projects.name: CRUK Programme Foundation Award
projects.summary: Elucidating molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying T-cell dysfunction and effective anti- cancer T-cell responses: towards the development of next-generation immunotherapy
